title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #865: Pairwise Sums in Dense Sets**

If |A| ≥ (5/8)N + C, must there exist distinct a,b,c with all pairwise sums in A?

**Status:** OPEN

**Threshold 5/8 is conjectured optimal.**
mathContext: Connects additive combinatorics with density arguments.

title: Interval Set
content:
**intervalSet(N):**

{1, 2, ..., N} as a finite set.

The universe for our subsets.

title: Pairwise Sum Triple
content:
**HasPairwiseSumTriple(A):**

∃ distinct a,b,c ∈ A with a+b, a+c, b+c all in A.

The central configuration we seek.

title: Sum Pair
content:
**HasSumPair(A):**

∃ distinct a,b ∈ A with a+b ∈ A.

The k=2 case, solved classically.

title: k-Pairwise Sums
content:
**HasKPairwiseSums(A, k):**

∃ k distinct elements with all C(k,2) pairwise sums in A.

Generalizes to arbitrary k.

title: Threshold Function
content:
**threshold(k, N):**

f_k(N) = min size guaranteeing k elements with all pairwise sums.

The central quantity to bound.

title: Conjectured Threshold
content:
**conjecturedThreshold(k, N):**

(1/2)(1 + Σ_{r=1}^{k-2} 1/4^r) N

The Erdős-Sós formula.

title: k=3 Threshold
content:
**k3_conjectured_threshold:**

conjecturedThreshold(3, N) = (5/8)N

The specific case for Problem #865.

title: Classical k=2 Result
content:
**classical_k2_result:**

If |A| ≥ N+2 in {1,...,2N}, then ∃ a,b with a+b ∈ A.

Folklore result for k=2.

title: k=2 Threshold
content:
**k2_threshold:**

f_2(N) = N + 2 asymptotically.

The solved case.

title: 5/8 Conjecture
content:
**k3_conjecture:**

If |A| ≥ (5/8)N + C, then HasPairwiseSumTriple(A).

The main OPEN conjecture!

title: Lower Bound Construction
content:
**lowerBoundConstruction(N):**

[N/8, N/4] ∪ [N/2, N]

Has size ≈ 5N/8 but no pairwise sum triple.

title: No Triple in Construction
content:
**lower_bound_no_triple:**

The construction [N/8,N/4] ∪ [N/2,N] has no pairwise sum triple.

Proves 5/8 is optimal.

title: Lower Bound Size
content:
**lower_bound_size:**

|[N/8, N/4] ∪ [N/2, N]| ≥ N/8 + N/2 - 2 ≈ 5N/8

The construction achieves the threshold.

title: 5/8 is Optimal
content:
**k3_optimal_threshold:**

f_3(N)/N → 5/8 as N → ∞.

The threshold is asymptotically 5/8.

title: Erdős-Sós Conjecture
content:
**erdos_sos_conjecture:**

f_k(N) ~ (1/2)(1 + Σ 1/4^r) N for all k.

Values: k=2: 1/2, k=3: 5/8, k=4: 21/32, ...

title: Threshold Converges to 2/3
content:
**threshold_converges_to_two_thirds:**

As k → ∞, the threshold approaches 2/3.

The sum Σ 1/4^r → 1/3, so (1/2)(1 + 1/3) = 2/3.

title: CES Upper Bound
content:
**choi_erdos_szemeredi_bound:**

For k ≥ 3: f_k(N) ≤ (2/3 - ε_k)N for large N.

Proven in 1975, but weaker than 5/8 conjecture.

title: CES is Weaker
content:
**ces_weaker_than_conjecture:**

5/8 < 2/3

The CES bound doesn't give the sharp threshold.

title: Lower Bound Intuition
content:
**lower_bound_intuition:**

Elements from [N/8, N/4] sum to ≤ N/2.
Elements from [N/2, N] sum to ≥ N.
Cross sums fall in the gap (N/2, N).

No triple can form!

title: Sum-Free Sets
content:
**IsSumFree(A):**

No a + b = c with a, b, c ∈ A.

Complementary to our problem.

title: Max Sum-Free Size
content:
**max_sum_free_size:**

Max sum-free subset of {1,...,N} has size ~ N/2.

Related density result.

title: Schur Numbers
content:
**schurNumber(k):**

S(k) = largest N for k-coloring without x+y=z.

Related Ramsey-type question.

title: Main Result
content:
**erdos_865:**

1. Lower bound: Construction has no triple (5/8 necessary)
2. Upper bound: f_3(N) ≤ (2/3 - ε)N (CES)

Gap between 5/8 and 2/3 - ε remains OPEN.

title: Historical Note
content:
**historical_note:**

Problem of Erdős and Sós.
Earlier work by Choi-Erdős-Szemerédi (1975).
Erdős forgot about the earlier paper!

title: Open Problem
content:
**main_open_problem:**

Prove f_3(N) ~ (5/8)N, not just (2/3 - ε)N.

The sharp threshold is the challenge.
